private_information: I can only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I.
I can only pick up and place one top block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging all blocks into the target single stack A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J with J on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J.
I can only pick up and place one top block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging all blocks into the target single stack A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J with J on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' analyses and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that yields a multi-agent plan achieving the target single stack A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J with J on the table.

public_information: There are 10 uniquely labeled blocks: J, E, G, F, I, C, B, D, A, H.
Initial configuration by stack bottom-to-top: stack1 = J, E, G, I, B, H; stack2 = F; stack3 = C, D, A.
Only the top block of any stack may be moved and only one block may be moved at a time.
One agent may only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks and the other only consonant-labeled blocks.
The goal configuration is a single stack top-to-bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J with J on the table.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst for block manipulation who understands stack constraints and agent capabilities. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a clear, concise report of which vowel blocks you control, which of those are currently accessible as top blocks, and enumerate feasible single-block moves you can perform given you may only move top vowel blocks and only one block at a time.
analyze.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Use your goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Produce a concise analysis listing the vowel blocks, which vowel blocks are currently at the top of a stack and therefore immediately movable, and list candidate single-block moves you can perform. Do not produce PDDL.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst for block manipulation who understands stack constraints and agent capabilities. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a clear, concise report of which consonant blocks you control, which of those are currently accessible as top blocks, and enumerate feasible single-block moves you can perform given you may only move top consonant blocks and only one block at a time.
analyze.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Use your goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Produce a concise analysis listing the consonant blocks, which consonant blocks are currently at the top of a stack and therefore immediately movable, and list candidate single-block moves you can perform. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in producing PDDL files suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Your job is to produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that models two distinct agents (vowel_agent and consonant_agent) where actions are kept distinct by agent. The domain must include types, predicates, and actions that enforce: only top-of-stack blocks can be moved, only vowel blocks may be moved by vowel_agent, and only consonant blocks may be moved by consonant_agent. The problem must include constants for the ten blocks, the precise initial state derived from the public information, and the goal single-stack configuration A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J with J on the table. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Target FastDownwards semantics and avoid assumptions beyond the public information and the agents' reports.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use the vowel agent analysis: {vowel_report}. Use the consonant agent analysis: {consonant_report}. Integrate these inputs and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver. Keep actions for vowel_agent and consonant_agent distinct (for example, action names prefixed or suffixed to indicate the acting agent). Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
